Description: Fragment of oval handle from a Thasian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine, micaceous orange-buff. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and double axe symbol.
Curator's comments: Name Nauson. Bon, A. and A., Les timbres amphoriques de Thasos (Paris 1957) 1199. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 80, 16. For the date see Ch. Tchokev, The Athenian Agora xxxvii, 133.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0013)
